p: where P n is the net photosynthetic rate (μmol·CO 2·m −1·s −1), P max is the light-saturated rate of CO 2 accumulation (μmol·CO 2·m −1·s −1), I is the photosynthetic photon flux density (μmol·m −2·s −1), AQY is the leaf maximum apparent quantum yield of CO 2 uptake, θ is the convexity of the light response curve and R d is the dark respiration (μmol·m −2·s −1). The quantum yield was estimated from the initial slope by applying linear regression to the low-photon flux data (less than 150 μmol·m −2s −1) of the light response curve. The intersection of the straight line with the X-axis corresponded to the light compensation point (LCP, μmol·m −2·s −1). The projection of P max to the X-axis corresponded to the light saturated point (LSP, μmol·m −2·s −1).
